text:
Can see a lot of possibilities with the new Serverless functions. However, I wonder if it’d be more accessible/useful if they could be used directly in the CRM. An example would be in Workflows - adding a “serverless” action might be quite nice. Then somewhere in the interface to manage these serverless functions. Could also be triggered for transform/load processes when contacts are added. I like the idea of being able to select which function to use for an event - much like how AWS has included Lambada actions in most of it’s services.

Regardless, I think it would be useful to add a reference to Serverless functions in the documentation here: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/choose-your-workflow-actions#trigger-a-webhook> / <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/Workflows/How-do-I-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-Workflows>
as for the first part, yeah!  you should add to the community ideas forum and add link here as well so you can get some upvotes

Exactly what Dennis said.

Regarding the knowledge-base article:
Do you have any specific use-cases where you might specifically want to do this?

Allow clients to be able to edit the default templates once they chose to select one of the default templates in HubSpot. i.e. Clone the default code to their portal so they are not using a a template set that can not be modified in the future.
This makes it hard for people like me to help them without redoing the entire site on a new code base…

Could you elaborate on this some more Chad? Want to make sure I understand what part of the process is painful.

It is currently possible to clone a default theme.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/themes/default-themes#modifying-the-default-themes>
When you select a default template in a new portal to build off of. IT doesnt copy those files into the portal. It just allows settings changes
And this is happening when you clone the themes? The cloned versions are uneditable?
When you set up a new portal or the new CMS it asks you if you want to use one of the default templates or themes and if you select one from there it will not let you edit the code afterwards
